h3.a: Letter from DCE Superintendent, Dr. Lee

div.p: Click here to view the letter from Dr. Lee.

a.aria-label: Read more about Letter from DCE Superintendent, Dr. Lee

h3.a: DC Teachers and Staff Miss You!

div.h4: Click on the image below to view a video message from DC teachers and staff.

a.aria-label: Read more about DC Teachers and Staff Miss You!

div.p:
Dear Dallas City Elementary Families,
I must begin by saying how much we miss the children and our regular routines. This pandemic has forced us all to rapidly change. The Dallas City Elementary family of students, parents, educators, and community members has, once again, risen to the occasion. We thank everyone for your continued kindness, support and understanding.
Beginning March 31, we will begin . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Remote Learning Information

div.p: This is a reminder that Tuesday we will be delivering meals to those who have requested them and learning packets to each student's home. Please help us by providing a plastic container with a lid by the main entry to your home. We will drop off and pick up materials from the plastic container. This will help to protect the people making deliveries and will keep food and papers out of the weather. Thank you for . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Special Request

div.p:
Dallas Elementary District 327 E-Learning & Home Learning Days
Purpose
Dallas Elementary School District 327 students and staff will engage in E-learning & Home learning days when emergency days are implemented by the District. Emergency Days may be used due to extreme weather conditions and other extenuating circumstances that occur during the school year to ensure student health and . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about E-Learning and Home Learning Plan

h3.a: Letter from School Administration Regarding Cornonavirus

div.p:
Dear Dallas City Staff, Parents and Community Members:
As you are aware, we are entering a period of heightened concern regarding the Coronavirus. Please know that the administration is closely following this issue and are creating plans for the various scenarios that could happen.
We are leaning on our health department, Illinois Department of Health, State, and Federal government for . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Letter from School Administration Regarding Cornonavirus

div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 11:53 am CDT

td.span: Partly sunny, then gradually becoming sunny, with a high near 64. North wind 10 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.
Clear, with a low around 35. North wind 5 to 10 mph becoming light in the evening.

Isolated showers after 1pm. Increasing clouds, with a high near 62. West wind 5 to 10 mph increasing to 10 to 15 mph in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.
